definition: to use gain as a lure

sentences.english: It says they also tried to silence the victims' relatives with bribes and threats.
sentences.chinese: 并且威逼利诱受难者家属保持沉默。

sentences.english: Many teachers have switched to business because of the temptation of the high returns.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利诱之下，许多教师都改行经商了。

sentences.english: It cannot be bought, or gained by lure or force.
sentences.chinese: 它不能用金钱买到，或者通过利诱或武力掠夺获得。

sentences.english: Many teachers quit their jobs and go into business under the temptation of high salary .
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利诱之下，许多教师都改行经商了。

sentences.english: Will me, thrill me, you can never kill me.
sentences.chinese: 利诱我，威胁我，你永远无法杀死我。

sentences.english: Collect golden carrots and turn them into download gimmicks on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 收集黄金的利诱，使他们成为下载噱头在互联网上。

sentences.english: You cannot bribe it or coerce it , or reason it into staying.
sentences.chinese: 你无法跟爱理论，也不能用威胁利诱要爱留下。

sentences.english: Higher salaries are seducing many teachers into business.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利诱之下，许多教师都改行经商了。

definition: use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
to spur sb into action by making negative remarks
